clinical_study.official_title: Perioperative Nutritional and Hemodinamic Support in Retroperitoneal Sarcoma Patients. A Phase II Prospective Feasibility Study.

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione IRCCS Istituto Nazionale dei Tumori, Milano

clinical_study.source: Fondazione IRCCS Istituto Nazionale dei Tumori, Milano

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective feasibility study of perioperative nutrition in patients affected by primary retroperitoneal sarcoma

detailed_description.textblock: Aim of our study was to investigate the feasibility of a prehabilitation policy to optimize protein energetic reserves in a group of patients affected by primary localized RPS, candidate to a multiple organ resection surgery, as well as the feasibility of a standardized nutritional postoperative caloric target and its adequacy.

primary_outcome.description: Rate of adherence to prescribed oral nutritional support

arm_group.description: All eligible patients are screened in preoperative phase, at least 30 days before surgery, for presence of protein energetic malnutrition (PEM). PEM is defined according to biochemical and physiological parameters (Table). 3 class of PEM are identified: no PEM, mild PEM and serious PEM. Different nutritional oral supplements are provided according to the degree of malnutrition.

intervention.description: Preoperative oral nutritional support is provided according to malnutrition grade

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- every patient with retroperitoneal sarcoma scheduled for surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- chronic renal failure
- diabetes mellitus
- emergency surgery
- physical status classification system ASA>3
- any contraindication to arterial catheter in Femoral artery for PICCO hemodynamic monitoring
